title: CodeSOD: Building Blocks
description: Eli sends us something that's not quite a code sample, despite coming from code. It's not a representative line, because it's many lines. But it certainly is representative. Here's the end of one of their code files: }); } } ); }); } ) ); } }); } } ); }); I feel like someone heard that JavaScript could do functional programming and decided to write LISP. That's a lot of nested blocks. I don't know what the code looks like, but also I don't want to know what the code looks like. Also, as someone who programs with a large font size, this is a special kind of hell for me. [Advertisement] Picking up NuGet is easy. Getting good at it takes time. html:
by in CodeSOD on 2024-12-05 Edit

Remy Porter

Computers were a mistake, which is why I'm trying to shoot them into space. Editor-in-Chief for TDWTF.

Eli sends us something that's not quite a code sample, despite coming from code. It's not a representative line, because it's many lines. But it certainly is representative.

Here's the end of one of their code files:

													});
												}
											}
										);
									});
								}
							)
						);
					}
				});
			}
		}
	);
});

I feel like someone heard that JavaScript could do functional programming and decided to write LISP. That's a lot of nested blocks. I don't know what the code looks like, but also I don't want to know what the code looks like.

Also, as someone who programs with a large font size, this is a special kind of hell for me.
